module, annotation, schematic
This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to specify a schematic element. A schematic element is a patch, or set of patches, of colour, shading or texture within a 2D drawing, that can be linked to other information about the thing that it stands for.
A schematic element can be defined explicitly as annotation text, curves and filled areas. Alternatively, a schematic element can be defined as:
an assembly of other schematic elements; or
a geometric transformation of another schematic element.
the distinction between:
a schematic element definition, which can be used within many different assemblies of schematic elements; or
a particular usage, or occurrence, of a schematic element definition within a particular assembly of schematic elements;
the explicit definition of a schematic element by direct reference to a detailed specification of the patches of colour, shading or texture;
the implicit definition of a schematic element by:
a derivation from an other schematic element definition; or
its usage relationships with schematic element occurrences.
composition relationships between schematic element occurrences;
connection relationships between schematic element occurrences;
the specification of the nature of a schematic element occurrence by means of a subset relationship with a schematic element definition.
a library of schematic element definitions (i.e. a symbol library); A library of schematic element definitions is within the scope of the Schematic_element_library application module.
the relationship between a schematic element and the thing that it stands for. The relationship between a schematic element and a product or activity that it stands for is within the scope of the Symbolization_by_schematic_element application module.
The Schematic_element UoF identifies a schematic element and indicates whether or not it is:
a schematic element definition, which can be used within many different assemblies of schematic elements; or
a particular usage, or occurrence, of a schematic element definition within a particular assembly of schematic elements.
The nature of an explicit schematic element definition is indicated by direct reference to a detailed specification of the patches of colour, shading or texture.
The nature of an implicit schematic element definition is indicated by either:
a derivation from an other schematic element definition; or
its usage relationships with schematic element occurrences.
The Schematic_element_relationships UoF defines the following relationships between schematic elements:
the derivation of one schematic element definition from another by means for a geometric transformation;
the usage of a schematic element occurrence at a particular place within a schematic element definition;
composition, or whole-part, relationships between schematic element occurrences; and
connection relationships between schematic element occurrences.
